intro: Pimpinella junionae, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. It has a taproot system and produces seeds in small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
